back_cards.definition_en: Used to specify a particular noun.
back_cards.example_en: The dog barked loudly in the park.
The sun sets slowly behind the mountain.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a specific group or class.
back_cards.example_en: The students in the class were attentive.

back_cards.definition_en: Used before superlatives or ordinal numbers.
back_cards.example_en: She won the first prize in the competition.
I found a book, and the book was fascinating.
A new festival will be in town next week.

back_cards.definition_en: To act as or serve as.
back_cards.example_en: She wants to be a doctor when she grows up.

back_cards.definition_en: To indicate a state or condition.
back_cards.example_en: He is tired after a long day at work.
They are playing soccer in the field.
This is the best coffee shop in town.
I bought apples and oranges at the market.
She studied hard and passed the exam.
The hike was long and very scenic.
He was singing and dancing at the party.
The project requires time and effort.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a non-specific singular noun.
back_cards.example_en: I saw a cat in the garden.
She found a book on the shelf.
He works as a teacher in a school.
A bird flew over the forest.
I need a dozen eggs for the recipe.
The leaves of the tree turned red.
The house is made of wood.
A slice of cake was left on the plate.
She is a friend of my sister.
They talked of their plans for the weekend.
She walked to the store.
He studies to become an engineer.
I gave a gift to my friend.
They want to learn how to cook.
The meeting is scheduled to five o'clock.
The keys are in the drawer.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a period of time.
back_cards.example_en: We met in the summer of last year.
She is in a good mood today.
He works in the tech industry.
They communicated in writing.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to the speaker or writer.
back_cards.example_en: I am going to the park.
I think this movie is amazing.
I finished my homework early.
I am a student at the university.
I prefer tea over coffee.

back_cards.definition_en: Addresses the person being spoken to.
back_cards.example_en: You should try this new restaurant.
You can learn a lot from books.
I saw you at the concert last night.
You need to rest after a long day.
Can you help me with this task?
The book is on the table; pick it up.
The dog wagged it tail happily.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a situation or event.
back_cards.example_en: It rained all day yesterday.
It is important to stay hydrated.
I found a phone, but it was broken.
I have a new car.
She had a great time at the party.
They have breakfast together every morning.
You have to finish your work by noon.
He has two sisters in college.
We drove to the beach last weekend.
She trains to run a marathon.
He sent a letter to his cousin.
I need to finish this report.
The shop is open to seven tonight.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a specific thing or person.
back_cards.example_en: I like that painting on the wall.
The book that I read was thrilling.
It was that moment when everything changed.

back_cards.definition_en: Points to a previously mentioned idea.
back_cards.example_en: She said she was tired, and that was true.

back_cards.definition_en: Connects to a result or reason.
back_cards.example_en: He was so late that he missed the meeting.
She bought flowers for the party.
They stayed for three hours.
This gift is for my brother.
I am voting for the new policy.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a cause or motive.
back_cards.example_en: He was praised for his hard work.
I do my exercises every morning.
She did her homework before dinner.
You do need to listen carefully.
What do you do for a living?
He cleans as well as she does.
He is my best friend.
He works as a chef in a restaurant.

back_cards.definition_en: Points to a specific man mentioned.
back_cards.example_en: I saw him, and he waved back.
He climbed the mountain alone.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a male in a role.
back_cards.example_en: He is the captain of the team.
She went to the party with her friends.

back_cards.definition_en: Shows the means or tool used.
back_cards.example_en: He cut the paper with scissors.
I work with a great team.
She spoke with confidence.
The man with the hat is my uncle.
The cup is on the table.
We meet on Fridays.
The picture hangs on the wall.
She gave a talk on climate change.
His decision was based on facts.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to something nearby or current.
back_cards.example_en: This book is my favorite.
I bought this shirt yesterday.
This is why I love hiking.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to emphasize the present moment.
back_cards.example_en: This summer has been amazing.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a close object or idea.
back_cards.example_en: This idea could change everything.
I can't go to the party tonight.
She doesn't like spicy food.
You shouldn't run in the hallway.
He won't finish the project on time.
They aren't coming to the meeting.
